io.straas.android.sdk.messaging

Class ChatroomManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.straas.android.sdk.messaging.ChatroomManager

  • public class ChatroomManager
extends Object
    ChatroomManager is used to manage a chatroom or a message board.

    You could call initialize() to get a ChatroomManager. This method will check your developer credential and construct a ChatroomManager if you are authorized. Then, you could call connect(String, Identity) to connect to a chatroom and start using other methods.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes

      static class  ChatroomManager.ChatroomConfig
      Configuration for ChatroomManager.

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public static com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<ChatroomManager> initialize()
        Constructs a ChatroomManager if you are a authorized developer.
        Returns:
        You could get a ChatroomManager if Task.isSuccessful().

      • initialize

        public static com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<ChatroomManager> initialize(@NonNull
                                                                            ChatroomManager.ChatroomConfig config)
        Constructs a ChatroomManager if you are a authorized developer.
        Parameters:
        config - configuration about the ChatroomManager
        Returns:
        You could get a ChatroomManager if Task.isSuccessful().

      • connect

        public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<Void> connect(@NonNull
                                                       String chatroomName,
                                                       @NonNull
                                                       Identity identity)
        Connects to a chatroom.

        This method should only be called when the chatroom state is ChatroomState.IDLE.

        Parameters:
        chatroomName - Target chatroom name.
        identity - The user who connecting to a chatroom. see Identity. If Identity is a guest, this person will login as a guest named "Guest".

      • resetIdentity

        public boolean resetIdentity(Identity identity)
        Resets Identity. If you receive MessagingException.UnauthorizedException when the chatroom state is ChatroomState.CONNECTED, it means the member token in Identity is expired or invalid. Then, you can use this method to put new Identity in. Notice that the new Identity and the old Identity have to represent the same person.

        This method should only be called when the chatroom state is ChatroomState.CONNECTED.

        Parameters:
        identity - New identity.
        Returns:
        True if reset succeeds.

      • getMessages

        public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<Message[]> getMessages(MessageRequest request)
        Get Message history in this chatroom. You can set the request rule in MessageRequest.

        This method should only be called when the chatroom state is ChatroomState.CONNECTED.

        Parameters:
        request - request rule, see MessageRequest
        Returns:
        You could get the target Message if Task.isSuccessful().

      • getAggregatedData

        public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<AggregatedData[]> getAggregatedData(MessageRequest request)
        Get aggregated-data history in this chatroom. You can set the request rule in MessageRequest.

        This method should only be called when the chatroom state is ChatroomState.CONNECTED.

        Parameters:
        request - request rule, see MessageRequest
        Returns:
        You could get the target AggregatedData arrays if Task.isSuccessful().

      • getRawData

        public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<Message[]> getRawData(MessageRequest request)
        Get RawData history in this chatroom. You can set the request rule in MessageRequest.

        This method should only be called when the chatroom state is ChatroomState.CONNECTED.

        Parameters:
        request - request rule, see MessageRequest
        Returns:
        You could get the target Message if Task.isSuccessful().

      • getUsers

        public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<User[]> getUsers(UserType userType)
        Gets users in this chatroom. The maximum returned count is 200. Users will be returned in the order [Role.GLOBAL_MANAGER > Role.LOCAL_MANAGER > Role.MASTER > Role.MODERATOR > Role.NORMAL > Role.BLOCKED)] and user updated time.

        This method should only be called when the chatroom state is ChatroomState.CONNECTED.

        Parameters:
        userType - decides who should be returned
        Returns:
        You could get the target User if Task.isSuccessful().

      • getChatroomInfo

        public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<ChatroomInfo> getChatroomInfo()
        Gets ChatroomInfo of current chatroom.

        This method should only be called when the chatroom state is ChatroomState.CONNECTED.

        Returns:
        You could get a ChatroomInfo if Task.isSuccessful().

      • updateNickname

        public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<Void> updateNickname(String name)
        Updates current user's nick name to server.

        This method should only be called when the chatroom state is ChatroomState.CONNECTED and the current user is a guest.

        Parameters:
        name - New nick name.

      • updateUserRole

        public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<Void> updateUserRole(User user,
                                                              Role role)
        Update a user's role. You can use this method only to change user from Role.NORMAL to Role.MODERATOR or from Role.MODERATOR to Role.NORMAL.

        This method should only be called when the chatroom state is ChatroomState.CONNECTED and the current user is a Role.GLOBAL_MANAGER, Role.LOCAL_MANAGER, Role.MASTER.

        Parameters:
        user - the target user
        role - new Role

      • updateUserRoleByMemberId

        public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<Void> updateUserRoleByMemberId(String memberId,
                                                                        Role role)
        Update a user's role by memberId. You can use this method only to change user from Role.NORMAL to Role.MODERATOR or from Role.MODERATOR to Role.NORMAL.

        This method should only be called when the chatroom state is ChatroomState.CONNECTED and the current user is a Role.GLOBAL_MANAGER, Role.LOCAL_MANAGER, Role.MASTER.

        Parameters:
        memberId - the target user's member id
        role - new Role

      • blockUsers

        public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<Void> blockUsers(List<User> users)
        Block target users. A blocked user can't send message.

        This method should only be called when the chatroom state is ChatroomState.CONNECTED and the current user is a Role.GLOBAL_MANAGER, Role.LOCAL_MANAGER, Role.MASTER, or Role.MODERATOR.

        Parameters:
        users - The target users.

      • reviveUsers

        public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<Void> reviveUsers(List<User> users)
        Revive users from blocked status.

        This method should only be called when the chatroom state is ChatroomState.CONNECTED and the current user is a Role.GLOBAL_MANAGER, Role.LOCAL_MANAGER, Role.MASTER, or Role.MODERATOR.

        Parameters:
        users - The target users.

      • removeMessage

        public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<Void> removeMessage(Message message)
        Remove message.

        This method should only be called when the chatroom state is ChatroomState.CONNECTED and the current user is a Role.GLOBAL_MANAGER, Role.LOCAL_MANAGER, Role.MASTER, or Role.MODERATOR.

        Parameters:
        message - The message to remove.

      • sendMessage

        public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<Void> sendMessage(String message)
        Sends message to chatroom. This method can't be called more than once within one second, or you will receive MessagingException.PermissionException.

        This method should only be called when the chatroom state is ChatroomState.CONNECTED.

        Parameters:
        message - message, should be within 500 characters and shouldn't be empty

      • pinMessage

        public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<Void> pinMessage(Message message)
        Pin a message to this chatroom, then everybody in this chatroom can get the pinned message by getPinnedMessage() or EventListener.onPinnedMessageUpdated(Message). A chatroom can only have a pinned message at one time, it means this method will override the last pinned message.

        This method should only be called when the chatroom state is ChatroomState.CONNECTED and the current user is a Role.GLOBAL_MANAGER, Role.LOCAL_MANAGER, Role.MASTER, or Role.MODERATOR.

        Parameters:
        message - the message you want to pin
        Returns:
        the task result
        See Also:
        unpinMessage(), getPinnedMessage(), EventListener.onPinnedMessageUpdated(Message)

      • unpinMessage

        public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<Void> unpinMessage()
        Unpin the message from chatroom.

        This method should only be called when the chatroom state is ChatroomState.CONNECTED and the current user is a Role.GLOBAL_MANAGER, Role.LOCAL_MANAGER, Role.MASTER, or Role.MODERATOR.

        Returns:
        the task result
        See Also:
        pinMessage(Message), getPinnedMessage(), EventListener.onPinnedMessageUpdated(Message)

      • sendAggregatedData

        public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<Void> sendAggregatedData(String message)
        Send a string to chatroom which will be aggregated in onAggregatedDataAdded.

        This method should only be called when the chatroom state is ChatroomState.CONNECTED.

        Parameters:
        message - A simple string, e.g. "like", "cry", should within 100 characters.

      • sendRawData

        public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<Void> sendRawData(@NonNull
                                                           RawData rawData)
        Send the RawData to chatroom.

        This type of message will not be aggregated.

        This method should only be called when the chatroom state is ChatroomState.CONNECTED.

        Parameters:
        rawData - Use RawData.Builder to generate the JSON (RFC 7159) object

      • addFakeMessage

        public void addFakeMessage(Message message)

      • getCurrentUser

        public User getCurrentUser()
        Returns current user. If the chatroom state is not ChatroomState.CONNECTED, this method will return the cache of last connected user.
        Returns:
        current user.

      • getPinnedMessage

        public Message getPinnedMessage()
        Returns the pinned message in current chatroom. If the chatroom state is not ChatroomState.CONNECTED, this method will return the cache of pinned message.
        Returns:
        pinned message
        See Also:
        pinMessage(Message), unpinMessage(), EventListener.onPinnedMessageUpdated(Message)

      • getSticker

        public List<Sticker> getSticker()
        Returns available stickers. If the chatroom state is not ChatroomState.CONNECTED, this method will return cache of last connected chatroom's stickers.
        Returns:
        available stickers.

      • getUserCount

        public int getUserCount()
        Returns current user count. If the chatroom state is not ChatroomState.CONNECTED, this method will return the cache of last connected chatroom's user count.
        Returns:
        User count.

      • getChatMode

        public ChatMode getChatMode()
        Returns ChatMode. If the chatroom state is not ChatroomState.CONNECTED, this method will return the cache of last connected chatroom's ChatMode.
        Returns:
        ChatMode.

      • getSendMessageInterval

        public int getSendMessageInterval()
        Returns send message interval of current chatroom. This value means the cool-down time in second that user can send message. If the chatroom state is not ChatroomState.CONNECTED, this method will return the cache of last connected chatroom's send message interval.
        Returns:
        Interval in second.

      • getChatroomState

        public ChatroomState getChatroomState()
        Returns current chatroom state.
        Returns:
        ChatroomState.

      • disconnect

        public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<Void> disconnect()
        Disconnect from current server. After disconnection finishes, EventListener.onDisconnected() that was set in connect(String, Identity) will be invoked.

        This method should only be called when the chatroom state is ChatroomState.CONNECTED or ChatroomState.CONNECTING.

      • addEventListener

        public boolean addEventListener(EventListener listener)
        Parameters:
        listener - Listens result of connection and other events. See EventListener.
        Returns:
        return true if listener add successfully

      • addAllEventListener

        public void addAllEventListener(EventListener... listeners)
        Parameters:
        listeners - Listens result of connection and other events. See EventListener.

      • removeEventListener

        public boolean removeEventListener(EventListener listener)
        Parameters:
        listener - Remove listener which doesn't want to receive future event. See EventListener.
        Returns:
        return true if listener remove successfully

      • removeAllEventListener

        public void removeAllEventListener()
        Remove all event listener, no one could receive future event. See EventListener.

      • getTotalAggregatedData

        @NonNull
public androidx.collection.SimpleArrayMap<String,Integer> getTotalAggregatedData()
        Retrieve total aggregated data.
        Returns:
        each key-value pair represents the number of times the data string has occurred

      • setMetadata

        public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<Void> setMetadata(@NonNull
                                                           String key,
                                                           @Nullable
                                                           Object value,
                                                           boolean broadcast)
        Sets a set of meta data to current chatroom. See Chat Metadata.

        This method should only be called when the chatroom state is ChatroomState.CONNECTED and the current user is a Role.GLOBAL_MANAGER, Role.LOCAL_MANAGER, Role.MASTER, or Role.MODERATOR.
        Parameters:
        key - Corresponds to ChatMetadata.getKey(). Note that the key is unique of metadata in a chatroom. Key names start with _ are reserved, so these names are not supposed to be used. And the key must match regular expression ^[A-Za-z0-9][A-Za-z0-9_-@#]{0,29}$.
        value - Corresponds to ChatMetadata.getValue(). This will be converted to JSON (RFC 7159) type and the max size is 1k when broadcast is true and 4k when parameter broadcast is false.
        broadcast - Sets to true to broadcast this event, it means all users in this chatroom will receive the change by EventListener.onMetadataUpdated(SimpleArrayMap).
        Returns:
        the task result
        See Also:
        getMetadata(String[]), EventListener.onMetadataUpdated(SimpleArrayMap)

      • getMetadata

        public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<androidx.collection.SimpleArrayMap<String,ChatMetadata>> getMetadata(@Nullable
                                                                                                              String... keys)
        Gets the meta data from current chatroom. See Chat Metadata.

        This method should only be called when the chatroom state is ChatroomState.CONNECTED.
        Parameters:
        keys - The keys of meta data you want to query. Key names start with _ are reserved, so these names are not supposed to be used. And the key must match regular expression ^[A-Za-z0-9][A-Za-z0-9_-@#]{0,29}$. Sets this to null will query all meta data of current chatroom.
        Returns:
        the specified meta data if Task.isSuccessful()
        See Also:
        setMetadata(String, Object, boolean), ChatMetadata
